snippet: President Obama imposed self-constraints on his use of power in the war on terrorism, but his flexible approach gives Mr. Trump “a fully loaded weapon,” one critic said....
abstract: Pres Obama's flexible approach to use of national security powers may provide Pres-elect Donald Trump broad reach for pursuing extreme policies threatened on campaign trail, should he choose to do so; tactics endorsed by Obama as lawful for limited use, like  targeted killings in drone strikes, use of indefinite detention, torture and military tribunals for terrorism suspects, may be embraced on broad scale by Trump.
lead_paragraph: President Obama imposed self-constraints on his use of power in the war on terrorism, but his flexible approach gives Mr. Trump “a fully loaded weapon,” one critic said.

headline.main: Harsher Security Tactics? Obama Left Door Ajar, and Donald Trump Is Knocking
headline.print_headline: Obama Policies Give Successor a Path to Vast Security Powers

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
